Title: King Lear
Description: Shakesperean regent who divides his kingdom across his daughters Goneril, Regan, and Cordelia.

Title: Narizinho
Description: Personagem principal nas histórias de Monteiro Lobato sobre o Sítio do Picapau-Amarelo, é peralta e tem seu nome vindo de parte de sua anatomia que é famosa por ser arrebitada.

Title: E.T.
Description: Movie named after its main character which is an alien that gets lost on Earth and is helped by a number of children including one played by Reese Whiterspoon. He heals Elliot with his finger and they fly in their bycicles.

Title: Percy Jackson
Description: Main character in a book where he is accused of stealing Zeus's lightning. He then goes on a road trip to prove his innocence and save his mother.

Title: Calliope
Description: One of the greek muses. In Neil Gaiman's Sandman stories she has a child with the main character, the ill-fated lyre-playing Orpheus.

Title: Moloko
Description: Esta palavra significa 'leite' em Russo, é o nome de uma banda que o papai gosta, e descreve drogas no livro 'Laranja Mecânica' de Alexander Burguess.

Title: Ted Danson
Description: Tall actor who played characters in Cheers, A Good Place and Man on the Inside.

Title: Marie Antoinette
Description: A French aristocrat known for her elaborate silk gowns and even taller hair-dos who famously said 'Let them eat cake' when asked 'the people have no bread to eat.'

Title: Noite Estrelada
Description: Obra famosa por suas grossas pinceladas de Vincent Van Gogh representando o que via nos céus.

Title: Mona Lisa
Description: O quadro mais famoso do mundo, também conhecido como La Gioconda, pintado por Leonardo DaVinci. Atualmente exposta no Louvre, em Paris.

Title: Marion
Description: Caso romântico mais famosa do arqueólogo Indiana Jones, ela consegue segurar sua bebida e disparou as metralhadoras de um avião em que ficou presa.

Title: Sonic the Hedgehog
Description: Blue rodent who can run really fast in his videogames, his film became famous for its weird presentation of his teeth.

Title: Double Rainbow
Description: Meme famous after the person filming this video captured two of an optical effect in the sky and couldn't stop saying this phrase. What does it mean?

Title: Weird Al Yankovic
Description: Singer/songwriter famous for writing parody versions of famous songs, including such hits as 'Like a Surgeon' and 'Amish Paradise'. A polka lover!

Title: Dungeon Master
Description: When playing the famous RPG 'Dungeons & Dragons', this person has the role of describing the world around the players and adjudicating play as a whole.

Title: Metamorphosis
Description: Tale by author Franz Kafka that starts when Gregor Samsa finds himself turned into a monstrous insect.

Title: Final Fantasy
Description: Series of videogames created in Japan which became famous as one of the most recognized JRPG brands ever. They usually hinge around crystals, Chocobos, and feature a mechanic named Cid.

Title: Origami
Description: Japanese art of folding paper to create interesting effects. Its most famous creation is undoubtedly the crane.

Title: iPhone Charger
Description: This contraption used to have a lightning connector but changed to USB-C; it's important for powering your mobile device but is never around when we need one.

Title: Minotaur
Description: Conceived by Queen Pasiphae and a bull, King Minos hid this mythical monster in a maze constructed by Daedalus until it was defeated by Theseus.

Title: Do Not Disturb Sign
Description: Hanged outside a hotel door it asks cleaning staff to not knock and come back later.

Title: Fish Extender
Description: Consisting of pockets hanging beside a door, it asks other passengers in the Disney Cruise to leave small gifts and souvenirs inside.

Title: White Rabbit
Description: In the story of Alice in Wonderland, this curious rodent was always in a hurry, worried about making the Queen wait lest he lost his head.

Title: Pac-Man's Ghosts
Description: Four villains in the dark maze full of small pills that the player of a famous video-game had to traverse, guiding a yellow circle.

Title: Perry the Platypus
Description: A pet in the Phineas & Ferb cartoon, this marsupial is actually a globe-trotting secret agent in disguise, always fighting his nemesis Dr. Heinz Doofenshmirtz.

Title: Jet Lag
Description: The feeling we get after crossing too many time zones at once, this will hinder your sleep schedule.

Title: Black Lotus
Description: The most famous card in Magic: The Gathering, this is banned in tournament play due to low cost and overly powerful ability. It represents a dark flower.

Title: Palantir
Description: This orb was used by Sauron to communicate with his servants, including Saruman, who lost his sphere when Gríma threw it down from Orthanc.

Title: Milk Teeth
Description: Kids use these to chew their food, even if they are bound to lose them later when the new adult ones come in

Title: Calvin's Stuffed Tiger (Hobbes)
Description: The favoured pet and eternal best friend of an elementary-level menace who was portrayed in the famous comic strips with both their names, along with Susie, Mom and Dad.

Title: Saúde!
Description: O que a gente diz quando alguém espirra, originalmente desejando que sua alma não saia do seu corpo com o espirro.

Title: As Três Leis da Robótica
Description: Criadas por Isaac Asimov, estas regras governam o comportamento dos robôs.

Title: (Pie) à la Mode
Description: French expression for a wonderful combination of two desserts, this literally means a fashionable dessert.

Title: Golf
Description: Chamado de esporte por alguns, esta atividade concentra-se ao redor de bater forte numa bolinha com um taco.

Title: Mammal
Description: An animal with fur that doesn't lay eggs. Their name comes from the act of suckling an infant in one's teats.

Title: Darth-Maul's Lightsaber
Description: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age, this double-sided blade was wielded by a red and black Zabrak that followed the Sith.

Title: Álbum de Fotos de Viagem
Description: Uma coleção de imagens capturadas por um telefone ou câmera arrumadas em um livro mostrando os trejeitos e trajetos das pessoas que passaram tempo juntas em um outro lugar.

Title: Link's Master Sword
Description: Famous weapon wielded by a green-clad hero that strives to save Princess Zelda from various evils in a series of video-games by Nintendo.

Title: An HDMI Cable
Description: Connector used to plug a monitor into a computer, or a home theater to a TV set. Supports the copyright protection protocol HDCP.

Title: That Loving Feeling
Description: Thing you've lost, according to the 1964 song by The Righteous Brothers, performed by Tom Cruise in Top Gun.

Title: Narnia
Description: Land of the Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe, where the four Pevensie live their adventures.

Title: The Chicken or the Egg?
Description: Eternal quandary revolving around whether the animal or the container from which it's born came first.

Title: Brandon Sanderson
Description: Famous author of the Stormlight Archive and Mistborn, among others, his works often thread the line between Sci-Fi and Fantasy.

Title: Bird of Prey
Description: Type of winged creature that eats live meat, and also the name of the most famous Klingon warships.

Title: Pesach
Description: Famous Jewish holiday that commemorates the exit of the Hebrews from Egypt. Its name comes from the passing of death over the doors that belonged to the slaves.

Title: LNG (Liquid Natural Gas)
Description: Sigla representando a principal commodity que a mamãe cobre em seu trabalho (mas não a única).

Title: Samurai Siege
Description: Primeiro jogo de sucesso da Space Ape Games, trazendo uma estética japonesa para o gênero de 'constrói e ataca' popularizado por Clash of Clans.

Title: Hashi Sushi
Description: O melhor restaurante japonês de New Canaan, seu nome vem dos palitos usados para comer os típicos pratos japoneses.

Title: Cosmic Rewind
Description: Concorrente à melhor montanha-russa na DisneyWorld, apresenta os Guardiões da Galáxia em uma batalha temporal contra um vilão das estrelas.

Title: Michael Jackson's Glove
Description: Sparkling hand accessory worn by the major pop-star behind hits such as Thriller, Beat It and Billie Jean.

Title: Bill Cipher
Description: Equilateral psycokinetic dream demon, the antagonist of the 2010s show 'Gravity Falls', voiced by Alex Hirsch.

Title: Synchronized Swimming
Description: Sport where teammembers perform hydroginastics trying to keep the rhythm with everyone else.

Title: Carcassone
Description: A mountainous region in southern France, and also a popular tile-placing boardgame that originated the term 'meeples'.

Title: Slay the Spire
Description: Popular indie deckbuilding videogame that has the player fighting avian Cultists as they ascend a terrible tower.

Title: Chico Buarque
Description: Popular cantor brasileiro famoso por músicas contra a ditadura como Meu Caro Amigo e Apesar de Você.

Title: Millenium Falcon
Description: I'll have you know, this ship managed the Kessel Run in under 12 parsecs! Just ask Han or Chewie.

Title: Big Bad Wolf
Description: Antagonist to both Little Red Riding Hood and the Three Little Pigs, he keeps himself busy in the forest.

Title: Dragons
Description: These creatures exist in multiple folklores, taking the form of giant reptiles who can fly and often breathe fire or other elements.

Title: Blue Bloods
Description: Featuring Tom Selleck, this series follows a family that is all involved in law or police work.

Title: Hurricane
Description: The name of a song by Bob Dylan about the racial profiling and imprisonment of the boxer Rubin Carter, and also a destructive weather phenomenon.

Title: My Father
Description: Your male progenitor. Also accepted: his actual name.

Title: Curling
Description: Every four years during the Winter Olympics the world is taken by storm with the emotions of this sport involving sliding stones. Sweep! SWEEP!

Title: Abracadabra
Description: Word of supposedly magical properties, also a Lady Gaga song.

Title: Love at First Sight
Description: Phenomenon where people who have just met get infatuated with each other. See: Anna and Hans.

Title: (Drink) Coaster
Description: Useful artifact, usually square or round, that allows us to rest cold or hot beverages onto tables which might otherwise get stained.

Title: Grey Goo
Description: The hypothetical conclusion of releasing self-replicating nanobots that can feed on any material, this colorless substance being the only result.

Title: Dark Helmet
Description: This character, played by Rick Moranis in Mel Brooks's Spaceballs, is a parody of Darth Vader.

Title: Indiana Jones's Whip
Description: The loyal weapon and forever companion of the intrepid archeologist who recovered the Lost Ark and even the Holy Grail

Title: Brigadeiros
Description: Docinhos de leite condensado inventados pela esposa de um militar de alta patente na aeronáutica que estava concorrendo à presidência.

Title: Nakatomi Plaza
Description: Office building where, one christmas in 1988, Bruce Willis sparred with Alan Rickman.

Title: Bocejo
Description: Reação involuntária feita com a boca frequentemente associado ao sono ou falta de interesse.

Title: A Butterfly's Pupa (or Chrysalis)
Description: Intermediary stage of development for a particular insect, this is neither a multi-legged crawler nor a beautiful flier.

Title: Crosswords
Description: A versatile game which can be tough for many and consists of intersecting blocks cointaining letters in a grid. It can be usually found in your daily newspaper.

Title: Ketechup
Description: A non-Newtonian fluid that is very well known and associated with fast food.

Title: Cheerios
Description: A popular brand with cereal whose name is associated with happiness

Title: Stay Puft (Marshmallow Man)
Description: Giant fictional character that was the final antagonist in the original Ghostbusters movie.

Title: Curtain
Description: A piece of fabric used for privacy.

Title: The Sinking of the Titanic
Description: The 3 hours and 14 minutes it took for the 'Unsinkable' to go under.

Title: Incognito Mode or Private Window
Description: When you're not keen on others checking your search history, you may use this.

Title: Griffon
Description: This noble mythical creature is a hybrid of a lion and an eagle.

Title: Postscriptum
Description: The matter written after the signature, often signaled by the initials of this latin term.
